result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Patrick Buege

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James Patrick Buege appeared by video.  Attorney James Edgar Toran appeared by video for James Patrick Buege.  Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing. 
Court is in receipt of  the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Elements of the Offense.
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 

The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement. 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and entered a plea of GUILTY
Defendant  examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  
The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
The Court reviewed the Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement with the defendant.  
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended until Review Hearing.  
Parties informed this matter has been reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17. Review Hearing scheduled
Review hearing scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights
Received and Filed. Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement
Received and Filed. Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights

Defendant James Patrick Buege in court.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for James Patrick Buege.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Matter set for DPA hearing.  Parties request a short adjournment. Case is adjourned to Br. 1. This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant James Patrick Buege appeared by video.  Attorney James Edgar Toran appeared by video for James Patrick Buege.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
OFF THE RECORD.  Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Toran requests a DPA hearing date. Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant James Patrick Buege in court.  Prosecuting attorney Kimberly Dorice Schoepp in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 1 for a Pretrial Conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/1/22 @ 2:30p
